name: D1. Divan and Kostomuksha  easy version
statement:
Once in found an array a consisting of positive integers. Now he wants
to reorder the elements of a to maximize the value of the following
function:
sum_{i=1}^n
operatorname{gcd}(a_1,
, a_2,
,
dots,
, a_i), where
operatorname{gcd}(x_1, x_2,
ldots, x_k) denotes the greatest common divisor of integers x_1, x_2,
ldots, x_k, and
operatorname{gcd}(x) = x for any integer x.Reordering elements of an
array means changing the order of elements in the array arbitrary, or
leaving the initial order.Of course, can solve this problem. However, he
found it interesting, so he decided to share it with you.
